intro: Psychotria luschnathiana, commonly known as the sacred or holy plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with humid climates. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It contains various alkaloids, including harmine and tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), which contribute to its psychoactive properties. Due to its chemical composition, it has been used in traditional rituals and has attracted scientific interest for its potential medicinal applications.
